intro: Lithospermum ledebourii, commonly known as desert lithosperm, is a perennial flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spindle-shaped roots that help it survive in harsh, dry environments. Lithospermum ledebourii is adapted to rocky soils and can thrive in full sun, making it a hardy species in xerophytic ecosystems. Its medicinal properties have been studied for their potential in traditional herbal remedies.
